resources.string: Your next week of testing begins in one month on {DATE}. You may adjust this schedule up to 7 days.
Reminder: Your next testing cycle starts in one week. Tap to confirm or reschedule.
Reminder: Your next testing cycle begins tomorrow. Tap to confirm or reschedule.
It\'s time for the first test of the week! Start your streak by completing this test by {TIME}.
It\'s time for the first test of the day! This test will be available until {TIME}.
You\'re halfway through the week. Keep it up! Today\'s first test will be available until {TIME}.
You\'re on the last day of testing this week! Your first test of the day will be available until {TIME}.
It\'s time for today\'s second test! This test will be available until {TIME}.
Your third test of the day is now available. Please complete this test by {TIME}.
The last test of the day is here! Finish strong by completing this test by {TIME}.
It\'s time to take your last test of the week! Please finish it by {TIME}. Your coordinator will contact you about your earnings shortly.
You\'ve missed your tests. If you\'re unable \nto finish this week, please contact your study coordinator.
This ensures that you\'re notified of tests at the correct time.
What week are you able to test?
Great! Your next testing cycle will be {DATE1} through {DATE2}.
By signing in you agree to our
To confirm, please re-enter your ARC ID:
We\'ve sent a security code to your phone with number ending in {##}.
Keep in mind that it might take a few minutes to receive your security code.

Every six months, you will be asked to complete one week of cognitive tests. During the week, you will be reminded 4 times a day to complete tests within the app. You may be in the study for as long as 5 years (10 weeks of testing).
I commit to participate for the length of the study
I\'m NOT able to commit to this study

Thank you for letting us know you are not able to commit to the study at this time. If you need any questions answered before continuing with the study, please contact the study team by clicking HELP in the upper right hand corner of the screen.

To participate in the ARC study, you must commit to the required testing schedule. You previously indicated that you were unable to do so.

If you\'d like to participate, tap Next to review the requirements. If you\'d like to leave the study, please contact your study coordinator.
Your participation in this study and every task you complete contributes to advancing Alzheimer\'s Disease research.

We use notifications to let you know it\'s time to take a test. Notifications are essential for the study to function properly. Please allow notifications for this app throughout the duration of the study.
Please tap \"allow\" so we can tell you when tests are available.
You must turn on notifications for the study to function properly. Please visit the Settings App, tap Notifications, then tap EXR and turn on the Allow Notifications switch.
You must turn on notifications for the study to function properly. Please go to Settings and make sure notifications for {APP_NAME} are turned on.
We\'ll now open your Settings. Once there, tap Notifications, and turn on the Allow Notifications Switch.

Now, we\'ll ask you a few questions to help us determine when to send you those notifications. \n

\nYou will only receive notifications during your waking hours. Please set a minimum 8-hour window of availability.
What time should we start your notifications each day?
What time should we stop your notifications each day?
Please set a minimum of {HOURS} hours of availability.
Please set a maximum of {HOURS} hours of availability.
Great! We\'ll only send you reminders between {TIME1} and {TIME2}.
Great! Starting tomorrow, we\'ll only send you reminders between {TIME1} and {TIME2}.
What week are you able to test?
Great! Your next testing cycle will be {DATE1} through {DATE2}.
Please sign your initials on the line below to verify your identity.
You have a new test available.
There are no tests to take right now.
You will receive a notification later today when it\'s time to take your next test.
We\'ll notify you tomorrow between {TIME1} and {TIME2} when it\'s time to take a test.
There are no tests available right now.
Your next testing cycle will be {DATE1} through {DATE2}. We\'ll notify you when it\'s time to take a test.
It will run from {DATE1} to {DATE2}. We\'ll notify you when it\'s time to take a test.
There are no more tests to take.
Your first testing cycle begins tomorrow.

There will be 4 test sessions per day for 7 days.\n

We\'ll notify you between {TIME1} and {TIME2} when it\'s time to take a test.
I would like to change the time of day I am available for testing.
I would like to change the dates of my next testing cycle.
I would like to call my study coordinator.
I would like to email my study coordinator.

The Ambulatory Research in Cognition (ARC) app was designed by the Cognitive Technology Research Laboratory (CTRLab) in the Department of Neurology at Washington University in St. Louis for participants enrolled in the Dominantly Inherited Alzheimer Network (DIAN) studies. The ARC app assesses cognition using frequently administered but brief cognitive tests. This app is intended for use only by participants enrolled in DIAN studies.
Tap a question to see the answer.
How long do I have to take tests?
Do I have to take the test as soon as I get the notification?
What if I miss some tests?
How do I know when I have finished the test?
How do I know when the next week of testing starts?
What should I do if I keep getting the message, \"No tests available at this time\"?
Can I change my testing schedule?
Can I see how I\'m doing on the tests?
Can I let my friend/grandchild/spouse take some of the tests?
I\'m not sure I\'m doing the test correctly. Can I practice?

You will get notifications for tests four times per day for one week, then no tests for the next 6 months. The individual tests take approximately 3 to 5 minutes to complete. A new week of tests will start every six months for as long as you are in the study.
You will have up to two hours from the time you get the notification to take the test. After two hours, you will no longer be able to complete that test session.

While we want you to complete as many tests as possible, we realize that you may lead a very busy life! It\'s ok to miss a few tests, but please try to complete as many as possible - they only take 3-5 minutes each. Also, when you get a notification, you have two hours to take the test; you do not have to drop everything and take the test immediately.

At the end of the tests, you will be asked to answer whether or not you were interrupted during any of the tests. Once you have answered this question, you will then sign your initials and press \"Submit\". This will mark the end of the test.

If you are not currently in a testing cycle, the app home page will indicate the dates of your next week of testing. Additionally, you will get reminder notifications one month, one week, and one day out from each testing cycle. You will have the option to adjust the dates of your testing cycle by one week.

If you open the app and see \"There are no tests to take right now\", it is possible that you have missed the 2-hour window for your test session. You will receive a notification when it is time to take your next test. That test will be available for 2-hours following the notification. \n\nIf you see the message \"There are no tests to take right now\" and feel that this is in error, please contact your study coordinator.

You can change the time of day you are available to take your tests at any point. To change the time of day you are available for testing, choose \"Resources\" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then \"Change My Availability\", and finally \"I would like to change the time of day I am available for testing.\" \n\nAdditionally, you can change the dates of an upcoming testing cycle when you have finished your current testing cycle. To change the dates of your next testing cycle, choose \"Resources\" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then \"Change My Availability\", and finally \"I would like to change the dates of my next testing cycle.\"

You will not be able to see the results of the tests. The data collected during the tests is for research purposes only and is not intended to make a diagnosis or treat a condition. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any concerns.

We ask that you complete the tests yourself, as part of your participation in the study. Following each test, you will be asked to sign your initials to verify that you were the one who completed the test.
You can review the tutorials at any time as a way to \"practice\" taking the tests. To do this, choose \"View a Tutorial\" on the instruction screen of a test.
What do I do if I change phones?
The app isn\'t working. What should I do?
How do I check if notifications are set up correctly?
How do I resolve two-step verification issues?
What is the Test Scheduler Service?
Why am I getting a message telling me to close other apps?

You will need to re-install the app if you change to a different phone. You also will need to contact your study coordinator so that s/he can disable the app on your previous phone in order to allow you to log in from a new phone.
Contact your study coordinator. If s/he cannot get the app to work in the moment, s/he will get back to you ASAP with a solution.

We collect your initials via the signature page as well as the results of your neurocognitive tests. The data will save to you phone until there is a connection. Once there is a connection, your data will be securely transferred directly from the mobile app to the study database using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) with encryption.

Your notifications are set up when you define your availability. You will receive 4 testing notifications per day during your availability window. You can change this window via Resources in the app navigation bar.

If you are having issues with two-step verification, the first step is to verify the phone digits on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. These two digits should be the same as the last two digits of your phone number. If these digits do not match your phone number, please contact your study coordinator. If these digits do match your phone number, the next step is to send a new code to your phone number. You can do this by clicking \"Didn\'t receive code?\" on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. If the new code does not work (or you do not receive a code), please contact your study coordinator.

During testing weeks, you may see a notification that the Test Scheduler Service is running. This service allows us to send you testing notifications at specific times. Since this is required for the study, it cannot be disabled.\n\nThe Test Scheduler Service will only run during testing weeks and will not significantly impact the battery life of your phone.

You may see this message appear during a test session: “Please close other apps to improve performance.” This may mean your device is not capable of running other apps at the same time as EXR. For the best performance, please close other apps before starting a test session.
What\'s the difference between \"this week\" and \"study total\"?

You can earn up to $32 per 7-day testing cycle for as long as you are in the study. You earn $0.50 for each test you complete (up to $14 per cycle). You also can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests.

Your payment will be processed immediately upon completion of a testing cycle. It may take several business days for your payment to be processed. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any questions about when you will receive your payment.
You will be paid via an electronic Amazon gift card.

This week refers to the amount of money you have earned during the current testing cycle. \"Study total\" refers to the cumulative amount of money you have earned from all testing cycles, including the current one.

Bonus goals are money that can be earned above and beyond the $0.50 earned per completed test session. During each testing cycle, you can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests. You are able to earn money for all three bonus goals.
End date depends upon your testing schedule.

Starting tomorrow, you will earn small amounts of money for completing test sessions.

You will receive an Amazon Gift Card for the earned amount after each week of testing.
You will receive an Amazon Gift Card for the earned amount after each week of testing.
Complete the following testing goals to earn bonuses.
Complete all 4 test sessions for the day to earn {AMOUNT}.
Complete at least 2 test sessions every day of the week to earn {AMOUNT}.

Answer questions in regard to your sleep and wake behavior on work and work-free days. \n

\nPlease estimate an average of your normal sleep behavior over the past 6 weeks when you were able to follow your usual routines.
I have been a shift- or night-worker in the past three months.

Please answer all of the following questions even if you do not work or do not work 7 days/week. \n

\nPlease don\'t forget to indicate AM or PM.
On work-free days when I don\'t use an alarm clock, I normally fall asleep at:
On work-free days when I don\'t use an alarm clock, I normally wake up at:
This is NOT when you go to bed.
This is NOT when you get out of bed.
The following questions will ask you about sleep specific to last night and waking this morning.
What time did you get in bed last night?
How long did it take you to fall asleep last night?
How many times did you wake for 5 minutes or longer?
What time did you wake up this morning?
What time did you get out of bed this morning?
How would you rate the quality of your sleep?
These questions will briefly ask you about what is happening around you right now in this moment.
Who is with you right now?
How would you rate your overall mood right now?
How would you rate how you feel right now?
In the past 5 minutes, what were you mostly doing?
You will now complete 3 quick tests
You cannot pause a test once it has been started. You cannot go back to the previous screen.
Were you interrupted or did you have to stop while taking any of these tests?
Please sign your initials on the line below.
By signing my initials on the line below, I attest that I completed these tests.

Please decide if the displayed price is a good bargain for that item.

The pair will only remain on the screen for a short time, so please make your decision quickly and pay close attention.
You will now see an item and two prices. Please select the price that matches the item from the previous section.

You will see three pairs of symbols at the top of the screen and two pairs at the bottom.

\nAs quickly as you can, tap the pair at the bottom of the screen that matches one of the pairs at the top.
Which pair below matches one of the pairs on the top?
Study the grid and try to remember the location of the three items.
Try to remember the location of the items
Next: Tap on the locations of the items.
Tap the boxes where the items were located in part one.
Thanks for completing the practice session today! Your testing week officially begins tomorrow.
Starting tomorrow, you\'ll earn money for each session you complete!
Thank you for contributing to our research. Your time and hard work are truly valuable.

Your next testing cycle will be {DATE1} through {DATE2}.

Please confirm these testing dates or adjust your schedule.
Your study coordinator will be in touch shortly with further instructions. In the meantime, check out all you accomplished:
Just a moment while we update your earnings...
It\'s taking longer than usual to sync. Check the Earnings tab later to see your updated totals.
This ARC ID is already enrolled on another device.
Sorry, our app is currently experiencing issues. Please try again later.
Tap here to view a tutorial
Tap here to quit the tutorial.
The Prices test has two parts. First, evaluate the price.
What do you think?\nChoose the answer that makes sense to you.
Another great choice! \nLet\'s proceed to part two.
What do you think? \nTry your best to recall the price from part one.
What do you think? \nChoose the price that you saw in part one.

Congratulations on completing the tutorial!
If you\'d like to take it again, you can always tap here.
This is a tile. \nEach tile includes a pair of symbols.
You will see three tiles on the top of the screen...
Tap the bottom tile that matches a tile on the top.
Great job! \nLet\'s try a couple more for practice.
In this three part test, you\'ll be asked to recall the location of these items.
The items will be placed in a grid of boxes. Remember which box each item is in. You will have 3 seconds.
Perfect! \nNow: Tap all the F\'s you can see as quickly as you can. You will have 8 seconds.
Nice work!\nDon\'t worry if you didn\'t find them all.
In the final part of the test, you will select the three boxes where these items were located in part one.
Hint: One item was located in this box. Tap here.
Now tap on the locations of the other two items.
Tap on the locations of the other two items.
Tap on the location of the final item.
This is the Home tab. \nCheck here to see if it\'s time to take a test.
This is the Progress tab. \nSee where you are in the testing week.
This is the Earnings tab. \nSee what you\'ve earned and how to get bonuses.
Questions? \nChange your availability, contact your study coordinator, and more in the Resources tab.
Nice job on the tests! \nLet\'s take a look at the rest of the app.
Please close other apps to improve performance.
Your device is not capable of running other apps at the same time as {APP_NAME}. Please close other apps before starting a test session.

Your phone has a setting to help preserve your battery life, and it is called a “battery optimization” setting.

The {APP_NAME} app will have minimal impact on the battery life of your phone. It is recommended that you turn off the battery optimization setting for the {APP_NAME} app. Doing so will help make sure you receive test notifications on time.
Next, there will be a pop-up asking you to turn off battery optimization by allowing the {APP_NAME} app to run in the background. Please allow to help ensure your notifications work correctly.

Your notifications are experiencing a delay. Next, there will be a pop-up asking you to turn off battery optimization by allowing the {APP_NAME} app to run in the background. Please allow to help ensure your notifications work correctly.
